clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Investigation on the Safety and Clinical Performance of Papix Acne Scar.
clinical_study.official_title: Open Label, Uncontrolled Clinical Investigation on the Safety and Clinical Performance of Papix Acne Scar in the Prevention and Improvement of Scars and Lesions Associated With Acne

brief_summary.textblock: The scope of this open label clinical trial is to evaluate and confirm the performance of Papix acne scar in the prevention and improvement of acne scars in subject suffering for mild to moderate acne. The product will be applied for 8 consecutive weeks and 3 clinical follow up visits will be performed.

detailed_description.textblock:
The scope of this open label clinical trial is to evaluate and confirm the performance of Papix acne scar in the prevention and improvement of acne scars in subject suffering for mild to moderate acne. The product will be applied for 8 consecutive weeks, 2 times per day into the face.
The dermatologist will perform 3 clinical follow up visits to assess the efficacy and safety of the product.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Multicenter, open label, uncontrolled, single arm, post-market clinical follow-up study.

primary_outcome.measure: To evaluate and confirm the performance of PAPIX ACNE SCAR in the prevention and improvement of scars in subject suffering for mild to moderate acne, after 4 weeks of treatment
primary_outcome.description: Indicate the proportion of subjects with improved acne scars and marks respect to baseline and, at the same time, without any new facial acne scars after 4 weeks of treatment with the change in the qualitative Scar Global Assessment (SGA) questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the performance of PAPIX ACNE SCAR in the prevention and improvement of scars after 2 and 8 weeks of treatment.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: two weeks of treatment and 8 weeks of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Indicate the proportion of subjects with improved acne scars and marks with respect to baseline and, at the same time, without any new facial acne scars after 2 and 8 weeks of treatment. The improvement of acne scars and marks will be assessed as the change in the qualitative Scar Global Assessment (SGA) questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the performance of PAPIX ACNE SCAR in the prevention of lesions after 2, 4 and 8 weeks of treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: two weeks, 4 weeks and 8 weeks of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Indicate the prevention of acne lesions after 2, 4 and 8 weeks of treatment.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: two weeks, 4 weeks and 8 weeks of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate acne severity after 2, 4 and 8 weeks of treatment, through the Investigator Global Assessment.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: two weeks, 4 weeks and 8 weeks of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the improvement of the skin roughness after 2, 4 and 8 weeks of treatment.through the Investigator Global Assessment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: two weeks, 4 weeks and 8 weeks of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the change in skin texture after 2, 4 and 8 weeks of treatment, through the Investigator Global Assessment
To evaluate the subject's adherence to treatment by the product accountability.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subject and Investigator Global Evaluation of Performance
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the subject's and Investigator's global evaluation of satisfaction with regards to the performance of PAPIX ACNE SCAR through a specific questionnaire.
To evaluate the subject's overall acceptability of the treatment through a specific questionnaire.

other_outcome.time_frame: two weeks, 4 weeks and 8 weeks of treatment
other_outcome.description: To evaluate the local and general tolerability of PAPIX ACNE SCAR.

arm_group.description: Papix acne scar gel for 8 consecutive weeks, 2 times per day

intervention.description: PapiX acne scar, class IIa medical device, gel for acne scar. to be applied 2 times per day during the 8 weeks of study duration
